item.title: Where Im From
item.dc:creator: lhennes4
item.content:encoded:
My name is Lucy Hennessy and I am from Canton. Ohio. I was born and raised there, and I still currently live there. I am a commuter student at Kent State University, and I drive about 40 minutes for my in-person classes. From going to a small private grade school to the biggest public school in my area, I have learned to appreciate the different opportunities that this town has to offer. When many people in this town moved away for college, I decided to take advantage of the variety of resources in my town, as well as save myself some money.

Another reason that I wanted to stay so close to home is my close bond with my hometown friends and family. I have two sisters, as well as a cat and a dog. I cannot imagine a life in which I do not get to see my sisters and pets every single day. I spend most days working at a local family-owned restaurant and spending time with my sisters and my best friends, who are also Kent State Student. I will never take for granted the luck I have had with the fact that my best friends have also decided to be commuters, and the fact that I get to see them whenever I like. I also greatly value the time I spend with my parents. We love to go on walks whenever the weather allows, and explore locally owned coffee and tea shops. In fact, a couple days ago when it was barely ten degrees outside, I bundled up and walked to one of my favorite cafes, which just so happens to be where my sister works.

This was the first day I ever came to Kent State for Destination Kent State. The people on the far left (Malcolm and Giana) went to high school with me. The other two girls in the middle I met earlier that day. This day taught me how easy it would be to make new friends and have fun while still living at home.

In many cases, people move cities or even just houses throughout their childhood. In my case that is not true. I have been in the same place since I was born, and it is one of the best things. I get to live in a place that is close to my friends, and to my heart. Walking through the hallways of my home I am flooded with the memories of me as a young girl running home after getting on the bus, coloring on the walls, and even when we got my dog. Every photo and item is a reminder of the life that I have lived. Where I'm from is hardly defined by the physical location, but rather the people and experiences that create the memories that I cherish.

item.title: Where I'm Going
item.dc:creator: lhennes4
item.content:encoded:
I have always believed life is a series of stories, which each chapter being defined by different experiences. I am determined to write my story with purpose and creativity. Right now, I am an Emerging Media and Technology major, with a passion of blending creativity with technology. The web is my personal canvas, and I love to create interactive experiences that engage the users. I have had many different projects, but they all boil down to the seamless blend of functionality and putting personality into my work.

This is just the beginning. Before I graduate next spring, I have many different chapters to write in my story. I am studying abroad this summer in Florence, Italy. Florence is the birthplace of Renaissance, a place where creativity and innovation together thrived many centuries ago and left behind masterpieces that continue to inspire people today. Immersing myself into their rich culture, exploring their art, and living their history will inspire my work in ways I cannot even imagine right now.

I also plan on getting an internship in the fall, possibly one with more of a focus on my minors (Web Design and Development, and Computer Information Systems). I want to take the skills that I have and will get and use them to grow into a career where I help other connect through technology. In such a digital age, I want to bridge the gap between human and computer interaction.

I hope to do something in Project Management, that way I am working with aspects that teach me how we interact with one another. It is important as someone who strives to create technology that I have a strong understanding of how users interact with their programs.

So where am I going? Hopefully somewhere where creativity, innovation, and storytelling collide. Somewhere I can continue to grow, inspire, and leave the world a little more connected than I found it.

item.title: My View
item.dc:creator: lhennes4
item.content:encoded:
The Future of Fashion: Where Media Design and Technology Collide

In today's digital world, fashion is no longer just about fabric and craftsmanshipit's about branding, aesthetics, and how clothing exists in digital spaces. The relationship between media design and fashion is reshaping the industry at every level, from how trends emerge to how consumers engage with style. The integration of advanced technology, virtual clothing, and social media aesthetics is creating a new, more immersive and sustainable fashion landscape.

Watch a video here:

Social media platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and Pinterest now play a major role in defining fashion trends. The rise of popular aesthetics like "clean girl" or "coquette" shows how visual storytelling can influence not only individual style but also brand identity. Companies align their content strategies to fit these aestheticssome, like Glossier and Aritzia, adopt minimal and neutral designs, while others like Nasty Gal and Fashion Nova lean into bold, expressive visuals. This alignment between content and branding helps keep these companies relevant in a digital-first culture.

Another huge shift is the rise of digital fashion, where clothing items exist solely in virtual spaces. According to Forbes, "Digital fashion allows users to build virtual wardrobes that they can wear for their avatars and social media posts or to other digital environments"(Salonga, 2021). Luxury brands such as Balenciaga and Gucci have pioneered digital collections, allowing users to purchase virtual outfits for online interactions. This shift not only enhances creative expression but it also promotes sustainability by reducing the environmental impact of fast fashion production.

AI and AR are further revolutionizing the fashion industry by improving the design and shopping experience. AI-powered tools simplify the design process, while also reducing waste and quickening production timelines. "Genera is shaking up fashions design-to-wholesale process with AI, cutting waste, accelerating the workflow, and pushing the industry closer to its digital future" (Rabimov, 2024). Similarly, AR apps allow customers to virtually try on clothes and makeup, as seen with brands like Zara and Sephora, improving the online shopping experience and reducing returns.

Beyond aesthetics and technology, the fusion of fashion and media design has significant improvements for sustainability. Digital fashion offers a way to combat the wastefulness of fast fashion by shifting consumer focus toward virtual consumption. As another Forbes article highlights, "The sustainable side of digital fashion means brands can reduce the need for physical samples and excessive production, ultimately lowering their carbon footprint" (Durocher, 2022). By utilizing digital-first strategies, fashion brands can remain at the forefront of innovation while promoting ethical and environmentally conscious practices.

Ultimately, the crossover of media design and fashion is redefining the fashion industry, bridging the gap between creativity and technology. From AI-generated designs to virtual wardrobes and immersive branding, digital advancements are shaping the future of fashion in ways that are both innovative and sustainable. As brands continue to merge fashion with media storytelling, the industry will only grow more engaging and environmentally responsible.

Digital Fashion: Where Virtual Meets Reality

How AR is defining personal style

Fashion is evolving beyond physical garments, entering a realm where digital and reality seamlessly blend. This composite image represents this shift, depicting a woman in a minimalistic space while her phone reveals a futuristic, holographic version of herself. The contrast between her real-world outfit and the digital ensemble on-screen symbolizes the growing influence of augmented reality (AR) and virtual fashion in modern styling.

With advancements in AI and digital clothing, consumers can now experiment with outfits that exist only in the virtual world. This innovation allows for limitless creativity, sustainable alternatives to traditional fashion, and a redefinition of personal style. As technology continues to merge with fashion, the way we perceive, purchase, and wear clothing is being completely transformed, making digital fashion an integral part of the industrys future.

The Digital Revolution in Fashion

How Technology is Transforming the Industry

The fashion industry has always been about innovation, but with the rise of artificial intelligence, AR, and digital clothing, we are witnessing transformations like never before. In todays episode, I sit down with my sister Sophia, a fashion merchandising student at Kent State, to discuss how technology is reshaping the way we shop, design, and experience fashion.

One of the most exciting advancements is digital fashionclothing that exists only in virtual spaces. Many luxury brands, such as Gucci or Balenciaga have already put their foot in the door and began experimenting with digital garments that consumers can wear on social media or video games. AR is also making waves in online shopping, allowing customers to try on their outfits before purchasing them, increasing sustainability.

During our conversation, we also dive into the future of fashion merchandising and how brands must adapt to a digital-first world. As technology continues to evolve, traditional fashion retailers need to embrace these innovations to stay competitive. The intersection of tech and fashion isnt just a trendits the future. Listen to the full podcast episode to hear our take on these exciting changes and what they mean for the fashion industry!

 Listen to the episode here:

Fashion in the Digital Age

How Technology is Redefining Style

Fashion has always been a reflection of creativity and culture, but today, its also a reflection of innovation. As technology continues to evolve, its transforming the way we design, shop, and interact with clothing. In this video, I explore how tools like AI, virtual try-ons, and digital fashion platforms are reshaping the industrypushing the boundaries of what fashion can be.

From personalized designs generated by algorithms to virtual garments worn on social media, the line between physical and digital style is becoming increasingly blurred. These advancements arent just about convenience or aestheticsthey also offer solutions to major industry challenges like sustainability and overproduction. Whether its through virtual samples that reduce waste or platforms that make fashion more accessible and interactive, technology is opening up new possibilities for both designers and consumers. Watch the video to see how the future of fashion is already hereand its more digital than ever.
